units.title: Introduce iTracer construct
units.text: This iTracer construct is introduced by electroporation into iPSCs that contain a doxycycline-inducible Cas9 cassette (iCRISPR)29,30.
units.rationale: Electroporation delivers the lineage recorder into cells that can be later activated by doxycycline.

units.title: Induce scarring with doxycycline
units.text: doxycycline introduction into the medium induces Cas9 expression in organoid cells, followed by formation of Cas9–gRNA complexes, leading to double‑stranded break formation at the targeted location in the fluorescent reporter region of the recorder.
units.rationale: Doxycycline triggers Cas9 activity to create barcode‑encoding scars.

units.title: Isolate reporter‑positive cells
units.text: Fluorescent cells containing the reporter can be isolated using flow cytometry before being propagated or cryopreserved for later use.
units.rationale: Sorting ensures downstream analyses are performed on cells that carry the lineage reporter.

units.title: Initiate cerebral organoids
units.text: From these uniquely barcoded iPSCs, we initiate cerebral organoids using approximately 2,000 cells to record lineages during organoid development (Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: A defined cell number seeds organoids that will carry the barcodes for lineage tracing.

units.title: Measure barcode diversity with scRNA‑seq
units.text: We measured barcode diversity using scRNA‑seq data from three iTracer iPSC pools and found approximately 60,000 unique sequences (Methods).
units.rationale: Single‑cell RNA sequencing quantifies the repertoire of barcodes generated.

units.title: Track barcode dynamics by amplicon sequencing
units.text: We followed barcode diversity throughout organoid development using targeted amplicon sequencing of the barcode region (Extended Data Fig. 1b,c).
units.rationale: Amplicon sequencing provides high‑resolution monitoring of barcode changes over time.

units.title: Optimize doxycycline treatment
units.text: We tested the duration and concentration of doxycycline treatment (Extended Data Fig. 1e,f).
units.rationale: Systematic testing identifies conditions that maximize scarring efficiency.

units.title: Permutation enrichment analysis of barcode sharing
units.text: We performed a permutation enrichment analysis using single cells from all lineage‑traced organoids together to determine the likelihood that barcode families were shared between cell clusters (Fig. 1g and Extended Data Fig. 4a,b).
units.rationale: Statistical analysis reveals whether specific barcodes are enriched in particular cell populations.

units.title: Visualize barcode distribution on UMAP
units.text: We illustrated regional barcode accumulation by projecting four different barcode families on the overall uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) embedding and observed that iPSC clones were distributed into distinct brain regions.
units.rationale: UMAP visualization links clonal identity to spatial and transcriptional cell states.

units.title: Live 4D light‑sheet imaging of organoid development
units.text: We also leverage 4D light‑sheet microscopy to provide an assessment of clonal and morphological dynamics as the neuroepithelium develops at the onset of brain regionalization.
units.rationale: 4D imaging captures real‑time lineage and morphological changes during organoid patterning.
